review.title: Nice People
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean but on the older side.  The rooms were OK, and the staff was very friendly.  There were other hotels in the areas if you are looking for a newer facility, but overall it was good.  The breakfast was very good.
review.locationRemarks: Location was very good.

review.title: Close to downtown, less expensive but lacking...
review.reviewText: The hotel was super noisy; heard every door slam, every trample down the hallway, and the neighbor's 5:30 am alarm... For 12 minutes! The bed was hard & uncomfortable. The vent in the bathroom was ridiculously clogged with dust bunnies and my allergies suffered greatly for it. Otherwise, the place was clean & good location. 25 min to downtown or golden gate park.

review.title: Bad experience
review.reviewText: This is the first bad experience I had with Homewood hotels in USA.

review.title: Nice hotel in the middle of nowhere!
review.reviewText:
We stayed for a week to visit San Francisco and vicinity.  This hotel was very nice, clean and the property was well kept.  It had free breakfast everyday and free evening "dinner" Mon thru Thurs.  The staff was very nice, and so were the other guests.  The air conditioning was very quiet, and the bed were comfortable.  There was no restaurant in the hotel.  If you wanted a meal, other than the free meals, you had to walk across the way to the next door hotel.  It is located about 15 minutes to San Francisco and about 10 minutes to the airport.

The view from our room was of Route 101, an exit ramp, and CALTRAIN tracks.

Keep in mind that if you stay here, you are going to need a car.  Also, there is a lot of traffic in SF, and wherever you go, you are going to wait on long, slow lines.  

Other than that, we had a good time.
review.positiveRemarks: It provided everything we needed during our stay.
review.negativeRemarks:
The pool area was lame.  It had no seats or tables, not even a snack bar.
If you forgot a toiletry, you need to drive to CVS to get it.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is located in the middle of nowhere.  There is nothing to walk to.  You are going to need a car.

review.title: Good location for airport
review.reviewText:
Suite was perfect for family of 6 
Breakfast was good

review.title: breakfast
review.reviewText: The free breakfast never went well. Not enough food for all the people that were there to eat. Definitely need to change that if that is going to be considered an amenity and a reason to stay there.

review.title: Excellent view at Marina a block .
review.reviewText:
I have traveled all over the United States,and stayed at great hotels.
The staff hospitality was on par with the Waldorf in New York.
Excellent value and location for the price
Close to all freeways,take the coastal drive on Ca 1 South and Ca 1 North,if Muir Woods is full you can see Redwoods along Ca1 North.
Napa Valley and Sacramento are close for the day.
Also take Grey Line for 2 day hop on hop off,as well as their Alcatraz and Bridge water tour, great way to see San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff and location
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Right in the middle of things to do!
review.reviewText: Very quiet area, not a lot of shopping or food places around this hotel but close enough to everything.  We went downtown S.F, drove to Yosemite and Monterey, took in an A's game and did the S.F. Zoo, mall not too far away for dinner and a movie...overall was great location
review.positiveRemarks: centrally located for things we wanted to do....that close to 101 was very helpful.  only minutes from airport but didn't have to listen to them
review.negativeRemarks: We had some very noisy neighbors with little kids...wish there was a little bit more sound insulation between rooms
review.locationRemarks: We hit Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Golden Gate Bridge, S.F Zoo, Baseball park, drove to Yosemite and Monterey....right by main highway

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText:
The hotel was ok, the rooms were smaller than you'd expect for an all suite hotel and the walls are THIN. I mean we could hear everything. The people next door had their radio on and we hear every beat of the song... Anytime someone came down the hall we could hear it... And anytime someone else's door was opened it sounded like someone was coming in our room so I was woken up a few times thinking someone was trying to get in our room. The room was decently clean. Breakfast was a bit of a nightmare- very small room for the number of guests and no order to the lines or way things are set up so you were constantly in the way of someone and being pushed around. Even though it was quite chilly that morning we braved the outdoor area just to get out of the dining room. The pool is very small and every time we went to go swim it was so crowded we couldn't get in. Might've just been an extra busy weekend but we were bummed we couldn't take advantage of that. 

Our dealings with the front desk were always pleasant and the location of the hotel was nice. We took a walk at the marina across the street and it was very peaceful and beautiful. I'd recommend if you got a really good deal, nothing to write home about though.

review.title: Good location, well kept, but small.
review.reviewText: We have stayed in Homewood Suites in many states and expected the facility to be like the others.  This hotel was OK, but the suite felt smaller than represented on the photos. The kitchen in particular was so small you could not open the dishwasher door fully - or the fridge door, either.  They banged into each other - not enough floor space between them.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, pleasant staff, good breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Redo position of fridge, so it would open fully.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport. Very good restaurants in the area.

review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. The continental breakfast was delicious and they're currently offering complimentary dinner from Monday to Thursday too!

review.title: The staff made the stay
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff, specifically Fred, were great.
Any request we had was promptly actioned.  
Great breakfast buffet.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the food available at breakfast / evening appetizers.
review.negativeRemarks: If they had an "on site" car rental outlet, it would be great to combine the hotel booking with a car rental....because you need a car when here.
review.locationRemarks: Removed from the tourists spots...but we had nice evening walks along the adjacent trail to the 'adult workout station' just north of the hotel.

review.title: Not too close to the airport, very close to SF!
review.reviewText:
We had a lovely stay at Homewood Suites.  I didn't have to cook ONCE because there was breakfast every morning and "dinner" almost every night - not Friday to Sunday.  Javier was also generous with the wine and beer!  The eggs weren't the best, but they were palatable.  I am gluten & cheese intolerant; and, I could find something to eat.

We only had a few "issues".  The biggest was that our toilet kept clogging.  However, the problem was solved only minutes after each report - it happened three times.  Every front desk person I encountered was attentive and professional.  The other was that our room was so close to the exit ramp to the highway.  It was fine for 6 of the 7 nights, but on our first night a cop pulled someone over using a megaphone at 3 am!  (Not the Hotel's fault, but the proximity did not help.)  There was no view from this side of the hotel, but we weren't there to see SF from the room.

TIP: There is parking at the corner of Jones and Beach near Fisherman's Wharf for $10.75 IF you get there before 10am!!
review.positiveRemarks: I loved breakfast every morning and the dinner reception every Monday-Thursday.  It saved time and money.  Also, the bed was hard but comfy enough!
review.negativeRemarks: There needs to be more seating for dining.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is VERY close to San Francisco.  15 minutes without traffic, but we also hit traffic which took 30 plus minutes.

review.title: Not up to Hilton or Homewood quality.
review.reviewText: We have stayed at Homewood Suites previously and were very happy.  This particular location was not up to par with others.   Construction in the lobby and next door were distracting but we understand that it is part of life and do not hold that against the hotel.   However, a smiling face after traveling all night would be nice.  We checked in around 11 pm.  Had it been earlier (or if we could have gotten our money back) we would have definitely moved on once we saw the room.    Personality of the gal at check in was non-existent.  The room reminded me of an old hotel and in desperate need of updating.  Kitchen was dingy,  appliances have seen better days, dishes chipped, utensils worn.  The "living area" was small, adequate for a short stay but no where near the quality or size of other Homewood Suites.  Other Homewood Suites that we stayed at had the most comfortable beds and comforters.   Not at this place.  Beds were just OK comfort wise but neither I nor my husband felt comfortable at this location.  Breakfast selection was mediocre to adequate (not expecting a gourmet meal.)  The only staff that was pleasant and seemed happy was the gentleman in the breakfast area.  We left immediately after breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Free parking
review.negativeRemarks: Update rooms and get staff that have pleasant personalities that like dealing with the public.
review.locationRemarks: Near airport.

review.title: Quiet hotel steps from the Bay and Trails
review.reviewText: The Bay Trail is steps away from the front door of the hotel. Very quiet location. There are railroad tracks nearby, but we never heard them, or the airplanes flying near the airport SFO. Breakfast is excellent. The day we were there, it was Hash Browns, Eggs, Bacon Sausages, Pancakes, and all the other easy stuff like breads, cereal, yogurt, juice, coffee etc..  There's a firepit in the Breakfast area's outside seating that are lit when the sunsets and stays lit for about 2 hours thereafter. Coffee is available all day in the lobby. There's an indoor pool and workout room. Parking is free is easy. Highly recommended.

We had queen suite, and that was very spacious for my three children, wife and self.  We didn't use the kitchenette, but it was nice to have the extra room.  All the staff, from the check-in desk to the kitchen cooks were very friendly and professional.  The only minus was that the hotel (carpet, furniture) was a little outdated.

review.reviewText:
I stayed in the hotel with my family of two small kids. The facilities are good but I was very disappointed with what they called a king-sized bed. It was not. 
Staff was very friendly and helpful.
We had the soap holder in the shower stall hanging from the wall when we arrived. They fixed it next day, but the duck tape holding it in place was there throughout our stay.
Breakfast was good. They offer free dinner with beverages included M-TH, which is a good deal.
Swimming pool was a hit with the kids. Although management sworn it was 84 degrees, my kids, husband, and other guests complaint about it being cold.
Overall, good stay.

review.reviewText:
We were in Brisbane for the Awesome 80's Run and this hotel was walking distance to the start line!  Also, Doc Emmett Brown and Marty McFly must have stayed at our hotel because the Delorian time machine was parked in our parking lot!

Nice continental breakfast and wonderful area to stay and get away.  Neighbors and air-conditioning a little noisy though.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice location, very quiet area
review.negativeRemarks: In the main room, the air conditioning was extremely noisy.  It was also next to the t.v. which made it difficult to hear

review.title: OK Hotel
review.reviewText:
Lunch Room relatively is insufficient space to cover customers. 

I have difficulty in driving to airport rental car area from there, plus find nearby gas station for fill up. 

In 4th floors by elevator, garbage bin was smelly whole day.    I should have talked to the staff but forgotten.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel Rooms are spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: If fire code allows,  door to washroom is better swung in instead out.   Basin area and closet are better if switch sides.
review.locationRemarks: You can have a short walk along the bay shore line..

review.title: Great value on the south side of San Fran
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived, after having stayed at Fisherman's Wharf, I noticed how much quieter the area was.  The lobby was inviting with fresh coffee, tea and hot chocolate always waiting.  The front desk attendant was sweet and helpful.  The room was clean and the set up was perfect for our needs.  I chose a king with a pull out sofa suite.  Which was perfect for our needs.  I stayed with my two daughters.  We felt safe and it was reasonably quiet.  The view was of the roof top so you may want to ask for a room at the end near the street and the bay.  They may be priced higher though for the view.  Not sure.  The room had a full size fridge, dishes, utensils, microwave, toaster, etc.  It was really quite nice if you want to make your meals in your room and save money.  San Fran is very expensive if you are eating out.  I don't think we ate for less than $65 for the 3 of us at any restaurant.  We didn't want to go to McDonald's on our trip though.  The parking is ample and not crowded.  The beds and pillows were fine although it could have had an extra blanket rather than a thin coverlet.  The breakfast, included with your stay, was pretty good... fruits, yogurt, cereal, hot food (eggs, sausage, bacon, biscuits and gravy) and a waffle maker, to name a few.  Pool is only 3 fet deep.  No hot tub but rights to use the hot tub at the Double Tree next door.  Overall, probably the best value you can find in the San Fran area.  I'd stay again in a heart beat.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Parking.  Free breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: The toilet was sluggish & needed to be unclogged as soon as we arrived.  The shower head hose was splitting open in 2 spots & will need to be replaced
review.locationRemarks: Walking path nearby.  Hills behind hotel begged to be hiked.  You'll need a car or other transportation arrangements to go places from here.

review.reviewText: The worst thing about the hotel was the fold out couch.  The mattress was old and had horrible support with springs sticking in your back. The carpets were old and dirty and smelled like the exterminator had just come.  The hotel staff was nice and friendly and the breakfast was alright.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff was nice and the breakfast is not bad
review.negativeRemarks: New fold out couches should be bought and the carpeting should be replaced in the entire hotel.

review.title: Comfort close to SF airport
review.reviewText: The Homeward Suites by Hilton were a comfortable and affordable way to end our stay in San Francisco with early flights from SFO. It includes a breakfast which is suitable for a 3-star hotel and similar to other "suite" hotels I've been to in the past.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport, comfortable room.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast wasn't very tempting.
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: Nice hotel close to SF
review.reviewText: Wanted to be close to our daughter who is living in SF. Nice easy 6 min drive to her place in the Mission.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText:
Great hot breakfast 
Shuttle to and from airport is very fast and convenient. 
Our flight was delayed, they let us check out and held our stuff while we took advantage of the delay to see more of the city!
The staff was friendly and very helpful. The hotel location is quiet. Food service good.

review.title: 2nd Time Here
review.reviewText: I like this hotel because of the free parking, free wifi and free breakfast. It's clean, comfortable and you get your own little kitchen and living room separate from the bedroom. I recommend it!
EXCELLENT ROOM AND LOCATION, BREAKFAST ALSO. WE BOOKED THE A SUITE ROOM FOR WEEKEND GETAWAY, THAT WAS WONDERFUL VACATION WITH THIS EXCELLENT HOTEL ROOM.

review.title: nice comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: everything clean, beds comfortable, breakfast buffett more than enough and neat
review.positiveRemarks: easy parking, staff, beds comfy
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: sfo airport. fishermans wharf, alcatraz, muir woods

review.title: Never come back again
review.reviewText: I wouldn't recommend this hotel to any one. The previous rating were misleading

review.title: Nice hotel close to SFO/downtown SF.
review.reviewText: This was a nice, clean hotel. We were not able to take advantage of the suite since we only stayed one night, but it was nice to know that the option was available.
review.positiveRemarks: It felt clean, close to SF and safe.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff were competent, but not particularly friendly.
review.locationRemarks: We went to SF both days, and it was not hard to get into the city at all.

review.title: Pleasant, Low-Cost Option for trips to San Fran
review.reviewText: Great value in over-priced San Francisco area.  You will have to drive to get to city, etc. but very positive cost-benefit analysis when compared to staying in a decent hotel in San Francisco.  Staff is positive/nice/courteous.  Hotel is everything you would expect from a Homewood Suites.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, price of room
review.negativeRemarks: Minor improvement would be shower head...mine was functionaly but seems due for a replacement as some of the jets seemed clogged.  But that is minor.
review.locationRemarks: Area is pleasant and feels very safe but is devoid of much to do or places to dine.  This hotel is a good base (close to 101) to travel from.

review.title: Anniversary stay
review.reviewText: We had a great time here. this hotel was very convenient to all the places we were planning to visit. I would recommend this hotel if you are planning on an extended stay having a Kitchen was great for midnight snacks when you get back from a long day and need a snack, they have pop corn in the room which was a perfect late night snack.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was clean and the staff was great, the house keeper even went out of her way to get us extra towels before we left for the day.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast was good, would not say excellent, but at least we did not have to leave to get it.. .
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is minutes away. We also visited Half Moon Bay, and Santa Cruz while we were there. Everything is so convenient to this location.

review.title: Good Value but..
review.reviewText: our room had sugar ants that got into my bag and all over my clothes.  Also, the family next to us did not go to bed until 3am, 3 nights in a row.  I called the front desk and nothing changed.  The breakfast was good and my kids enjoyed the pool.  No second bed, just a hide-a-bed for the kids.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, good breakfast everyday.
review.negativeRemarks: Rules enforced on noise hours, and having kitchens in the room will bring ants.
review.locationRemarks: near the airport and quick drive to downtown.

review.title: Great hotel. A real home away from home.
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. The staff was helpful at every turn.  The breakfast (daily) and dinner (M-Th) was delicious. The bed with those fluffy pillows were dreamy.. Ultimately, having a full-size refrigerator,  microwave,  and 2 burner stove top is priceless when you don't want to eat out all the time. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

review.title: Nice hotel, very near San Francisco and airport
review.reviewText:
I wasn't quite sure what to rate this hotel.  It was a beautiful hotel, great amenities, kitchenette, breakfast and dinner Monday to Thursday.  The bad part was the original room we were assigned was right next to the highways and the commuter trains.  Avoid rooms 101,201,301 and 401.  It is not pleasant hearing trains start up at 5:30 am and not end until midnight.

Luckily, I asked the staff if we could get another room.  About halfway through the stay, they did find another room with a view of the marina.  You could still hear trains, but nowhere near as badly as the original room.  Many families stay here, so be prepared for noisy children.  

Breakfast and dinner were included in the price of the room; that saved us a lot of money.
review.positiveRemarks: Kitchenette, free breakfast, dinner Mon to Thursday.  Short trips to San Francisco.  Only 15 minutes to the SF zoo and Golden Gate Park.
review.negativeRemarks: Insulation between rooms.   Housecleaning tended to forget to leave dishwashing powder and paper towels.
review.locationRemarks: About 15 minutes from airport and main San Francisco.  Also near smaller towns such as South San Francisco and San Bruno.

review.reviewText: Excellent in overall experience.  Staff was super friendly.

review.title: One week stay
review.reviewText: Full breakfast included - the friendliest staff ever - would definitely return & can highly recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was exceptional - super friendly - in all our travels I would say this was the friendliest staff we have ever encountered
review.negativeRemarks: The dcor is a little dated
review.locationRemarks: Very easy to get around & great for airport location

review.title: Not too far, but away from busyness of city.
review.reviewText: Nice base to recharge for activities in a great area!

review.title: Nice hotel, well maintained good location
review.reviewText:
The hotel was easy to find. It is very well maintained and the breakfast and dinner were excellent!
The sofa bed was not the most comfortable one, but that was expected. The staff was friendly, the pool was clean and having a full size fridge in the room is a good thing, especially when one travels with kids!

The walking paths around the hotel also were a good bonus.
review.positiveRemarks: Location Cleanliness Staff Food buffet
review.negativeRemarks: Heating is a bit noisy. Had to turn it off at night so we could sleep. For some people it might not be a big deal.
review.locationRemarks: You need a car, as it is not close to any shopping centre or restaurants, but they have a bus to take folks downtown.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. This hotel had everything I was looking for and more; free breakfast, indoor pool, gym and free parking. I was also really happy to learn they had free dinner Mon-Thurs and free beer and wine. The hotel were all super nice and accommodating and went out of there way to make sure our stay was pleasant. My kids enjoyed the pool and sitting outside next to the fire pit. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The hotel was very clean and quiet as well. Thanks for the great stay!
review.positiveRemarks: Free breakfast, dinner and beer. Free parking, indoor swimming pool, gym and cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: More TV channels.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, walking by the ocean, Union square, alcatraz

review.title: Nice hotel with a kitchen
review.reviewText: This hotel help us save money because it had a kitchen. They also have an indoor pool only about 3 1/2 feet ideas great f or the kids to go swimming at 7 pm.

review.title: First time to visit San Francisco.
review.reviewText: As grandparents and seniors, we have visited San Francisco many times but we wanted to take our 16 year old granddaughter for her 1st visit. The hotel is easy driving distance from the airport and the city. A great relaxing location and the breakfasts that were served every morning were delicious! Comfortable room, free wifi, and free parking made this extra nice! The staff was helpful and very friendly. Can' t wait to visit again!!
review.positiveRemarks: Hot pots of coffee and or tea were available all hours in the lobby.

review.title: Fair price hotel in good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniantly located relative to the airport and San Francisco downtown. Easy access from the Freeway. Excellent running trail along San Francisco Bay. Comfortable and well equipped room.
review.positiveRemarks: Room standard and equipment and location
review.negativeRemarks: The situation in the breakfast room is chaotic every morning. Silwerware, trays and plates are not always clean.
review.locationRemarks: Nice trail along San Francisco Bay for walking or running. Easy access to freeway.

review.title: Sweet Suite
review.reviewText:
We always find that staying in a room with a microwave and/or 'fridge are most helpful. Because this was a suite, we had a kitchenette with full sized fridge and couch area as well. It's near the marina, and away from busy noise and traffic, so, another plus. The pool was indoors, but no hot tub. There is in house laundry, and free breakfast in the morning, which was pretty good. All great stuff.

Only cons I can draw attention to were that our bed felt like it sank in on one side. The pool room smelled so strongly of chlorine that we had to prop the door open to get air.

Would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: breakfast in the morning
review.negativeRemarks: chlorine in pool was so strong, once you walk in the room, it feels like you're tasting it.
review.locationRemarks: Location is near the freeway, but away enough not to hear the noise. Near the marina, and a trail for walking/running/biking.

review.title: Stay here if you want to save some money.
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at this Homewood suites. I especially enjoy the staff, breakfast, and dinners they offer. They price for the suite is way more affordable here then staying in downtown SF. Some things I didn't like were the size of the bed. It was suppose to be a queen size bed but I wish I had a measuring tape with me because I swear it feels like a full/double. Also I could hear the fridge running while I was trying to sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was great and the price was good compared to downtown SF hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: My idea of suite is separate room for bedroom and kitchen. This place was all one room. I could hear the fridge running while I was trying to sleep.
review.locationRemarks: Close drive to downtown SF. Nice view of the bay from outside the hotel.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Very familiar, excellent facilities, suites as comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The Suites
review.locationRemarks: It is on the site must be close to everything.

review.title: Compact comparing to chain average.
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine in general. Although would be very challenge to have more than 4 in the room. The end of our stay had the hotel fully booked and the quality of the breakfast fall with lines for everything. We still could get a decent hit breakfast as the chef never lost his good humor. Free parking was great.

review.title: Nice To Stay Here
review.reviewText:
Free breakfast and dinner, cannot complain ( good food, good service ) and complementary beer and wine too!! Staff was nice, serves you as needed , feel like be at home. Only couple things that bother me :
1. The noise of commuter train behind the hotel , but wasn't often.
2. The sofa bed mattress was thin, it was not great quality. The hotel should provide 2 queen beds in the room instead of one king bed.
Anyway, that's really worth more than you pay compare to the other hotels. I absolutely recommend to everyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Free hot breakfast and dinner, plus beer and wine, free parking, free shuttle bus to airport. Location is good.
review.negativeRemarks: Two queen beds in one room or if one king bed, the sofa bed mattress should be better quality.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, midway to airport and downtown. Not too far from Silicon Valley.

review.title: Excellent hotel at a reasonable price!
review.reviewText: Our stay was great. Staff were very friendly. We really appreciate the complimentary daily breakfast n dinner (monday thru Friday) especially since there are no close by restaurants and grocery stores. There is a mall about 10-15 mins away but the complimentary daily breakfast n dinner was definitely a plus. This was our first family vacation that we didn't have to buy groceries and/or spend a lot eating out. So thank you to Homewood Suites for making us feel welcome. Would definitely recommend Homewood Suites to anyone who is looking for a decent hotel at an affordable price.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff and complimentary breakfast and dinner. Also the free parking.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown is about 10-15 mins away, which was great. The Tanforan mall is also about 10-15 mins away if you wanted to do a ill shopping.

photos.caption: Across the street from the hotel

review.title: Family friendly near the water
review.reviewText:
The hotel was great for our family. There was a king-size bed for me and my husband, and a sofa bed in a separate room for my daughter.

There were two hiccups with a missing blanket for the sofa bed and a TV not working, but they addressed these issues promptly.

We enjoyed the proximity to the water and took a nice walk. Just what we needed after the holidays with family.

review.title: It's a nice place
review.reviewText: It's a good place to stay but I think it needs a update in the room & I wish they would give it 1 hour more for breakfast everyday.

review.title: Great hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: We stayed 2 nights, directly after Christmas. We arrived right before they finished serving dinner. They suggested we eat before unloading our car. We swam and used the exercise room. Breakfast was good, but their was so many people that they were running out of food and coffee and only one person running around doing it all. Wr would stay here again and again! The staff were fantastic with attitude and kindness.

Upon arrival the staff seemed very annoyed that they had to deal with guests checking in. The room was simple but very dated. The walls are so thin that you have "the pleasure" of hearing screaming kids on the one side and a TV on the other. Biggest shock was the included breakfast the next morning. People were waiting to get bread, eggs, sausage, etc. Replenishing each item took about 8 to 10 minutes to then have enough for about 4 guests. The "highlight" was that they ran out of plastic knives, milk for the cereal, juice and most important paper plates to accommodate about 80% of waiting guests. Needless to say, we will never return and I can't recommend this hotel at all.
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING !!!!

review.title: Basically no breakfast. Stay away!!!
review.reviewText: On all 3 of out days at this hotel, there was basically no breakfast. My wife and I got in line for breakfast and there were eggs but the other 2 spaces were empty. So we waited 20 minutes for them to bring out hash browns and sossages. Then we went to go get waffles and there was no batter. I wanted some coffee and it was empty. Out of the 3 drinks: water, lemonade and tea, only the water was a quarter full and then that went down in minutes. This happened for all 3 days. I thought that this hotel was just understaffed but then on our way to our room, we saw 2 upper management employees just taking and laughing in the hall instead of helping out and bringing our food. We will never stay here again and will not recommend it to any of our friends!

review.title: Easy access to freeway and airport, great parking
review.reviewText: Friendly staff and good service. We had a 1 bedroom which works for us; 2 TVs and efficiency kitchen. Good windows as we were near the freeway and a train. Nice to have a good breakfast, coffee any time. Evening welcome meal adequate but not haute cuisine! Decent beer and wine and plenty of food however.
review.positiveRemarks: Separate bedroom with door and 2 TVs. Great parking for DF
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom ventilation system must be old and the walls can seem a little thin if you have young kids nextdoor.
review.locationRemarks: Have to drive in to SF. The hotel is on the bay and there is plenty of walking available but nothing touristy.

review.title: Dining area is too small for such a big hotel
review.reviewText:
Most of the times, dining area is crowded. And food gets over pretty quickly.
Rest of the hotel and stay is really good.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, staff and swimming pool
review.negativeRemarks: Dining area

review.title: Great hotel close to SFO
review.reviewText: Have stayed here every year for the past five years. Always fabulous.

review.title: Excellent hotel!
review.reviewText: Great staff, great room and great proce

review.title: Nice hotel but it is in the middle of nowhere.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was nice, clean with decent suites. Served free breakfast and dinner. Ate the free breakfast one day, the next two days we went to the Radisson next door and paid for breakfast.
There are no other restaurants in the area. Had to ask the desk clerk and she pointed me toward a small town main street about 5 miles away with a lot of small family style places.
The commute to downtown SF was about 20 minutes with traffic flowing pretty well.
The room price was 50% of the downtown SF room rates.
review.positiveRemarks: Cheaper than downtown. Nice view of the palm trees and bay. Plenty of free parking
review.locationRemarks: Location was nowhere and close to nothing, except a number of office buildings.

review.title: Excellent Service, Impressive
review.reviewText: We stayed here for one week and everything was excellent. From the clean rooms/facilities to the excellent service of the staff. Great breakfast and delicious dinner...yes free dinner with wine and beer from M-Th. The staff are so helpful and friendly. Annaliza,the breakfast chef and Fred were awesome. This is a great place to stay, look no further. With no traffic Union Square is less than 20 minutes away drive. Great location.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean rooms, great service and delicious meals.
review.negativeRemarks: outdated curtains and beddings can be improved

review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Appreciated the free parking, free breakfast, free dinner and drinks Monday -Thursday.
review.locationRemarks: Easy drive to downtown or Fisherman's Wharf area to catch Hop On Hop Off bus tours.

review.title: Drive up the coast of Cali
review.reviewText: We Luv Homewood Suites by Hilton, we flew into LA and stayed at the Homewood Suites there, then drove up the coast to SFO and stayed at the Homewood Suites in Brisbane. %min from the Airport with an airport shuttle pick up and 10min drive to the city.
review.positiveRemarks: the kitchenette and the staff is very, very nice!!
review.negativeRemarks: They need a restaurant and/or convenient store in walking distance.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport with free shuttle service, but nothing in walking distance.

review.title: Convenient and reasonable option near SFO
review.reviewText: I stayed here for 2 weeks on a business trip and found it a fine option convenient to SFO. The walls are a little thin, and the bed a little soft, but overall there's plenty of room and having the kitchen is a plus.
review.negativeRemarks: Some sound insulation.

review.title: Beautiful place and helpful staff
review.reviewText: We came with a group for a wedding in town. Had a lot of questions and requests for the staff. They went above and beyond what we expected or had experienced anywhere else!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff
review.negativeRemarks: Wish there was more shopping/fast food nearby

review.title: Nice stay for a layover
review.reviewText: We had a nice stay here. The buffet in the morning was decent - more than most hotels. The suite was really nice and large! We were not expecting such a large room. Some of the guests were questionable but other than that the place was really nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast was good, free lindt chocolate, large room, large bathroom
review.locationRemarks: SFO

review.title: Great professional staff and room
review.reviewText: Felt a warm welcome when we pulled in. Has Harry's lounge to unwind with plenty of local brews. Only disappointment was shower. They need to upgrade shower head and maybe not tradional I miss the wash cloths.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower was a disappointment. Shower head had no spray and no facial wash clothes.

review.title: Second stay here. Everything excellent!
review.reviewText: This is our second stay here. We love it. Rooms are comfortable with plenty of space. Staff is very friendly. The breakfast room was very busy. The staff did their best to stay on top of things but the food and juices kept running out within minutes. Not bad though. We definately will keep coming back here. Free parking! Fresh coffee and tea 24hrs. Our favorite place to stay while visiting SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool open till 11PM And keep torches on in patio till 11PM. We would not get back to our room till 9-10pm after sightseeing. We wanted to swim.
review.locationRemarks: 5 minute drive to Downtown SF

review.title: Employees Well Above Expections
review.reviewText:
There was a problem with the key card when I checked in . The desk manager sent someone from housekeeping. When he was unable to fix it, the Manager made up some new cards. She made a new set when those didn't work. She was efficient and apologetic, then upgraded my room.

Throughout my stay, the staff was friendly and helpful. Fred, in the breakfast room was extremely attentive and couldn't do enough for me.

Someone greeted me each time I passed the desk.

All and all, a very pleasant stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The Employees

review.title: Convenient for SF Bay Area visit
review.reviewText:
I stayed here for 2 nights for SF sightseeing.
Nothing special, but just reasonable price.

review.title: These Homewood Suites are Sweet
review.reviewText: This is the second time I've stayed at a Homewood Suites and I think we will look for these places first from now on. They are just nice with the kitchen and separate living area from the bedroom. Friendly staff, clean and decent breakfast. There rates are reasonable. The pool was only 3 feet deep and there was no hot tub so we won't be going back for that just for everything else.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the separate living space from the bedroom.
review.negativeRemarks: have a hot tub
review.locationRemarks: The city, airport and stadiums were close by.

review.title: The hotel was accessible to the event we attended.
review.reviewText: We booked the hotel at 10pm and called that we are arriving at 4am. The staff was very nice and even knew who I was when I arrived at 5 am. I was asked if i need a wake up call at 7am. When i said no ,he offered cookies and coffee. We have to check out that same day and he extended our checkout time to 1:30 pm which was very generous since the event was 2pm. Parking at that time was no problem. Breakfast was good. The staff anticipated your need before you think about it. The place is smaller and older compared to other Homewoods we had been too but the hospitality and courteousness of the staff is great. with my experiences with this hotel chain I recommend....nice,comfortable and great staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Affordable price,comfortable, accessible to the city. Great courteous staff. Nice and safe environment . Recommended to family in vacation and longer
review.negativeRemarks: When we arrived it was so cold. The AC was set to 65 degrees . We have to wait for time to get the room warm up. Other than that everything was nice .
review.locationRemarks: the hotel is near the freeway. Surprisingly it was quiet and cant hear cars. View was so nice you can see the bay by the window.Accessibel to SF city

review.title: awesome.
review.reviewText: Everything about our stay was great-- friendly staff, clean, comfortable, and recently updated room. The best part: not only was there a full complimentary breakfast, there was a full complimentary DINNER including hot entree, salad bar, and wine or beer. After a long flight with a child, I almost cried with joy.

review.title: Hotel clean, not enough parking.
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean the staff was friendly and helpful, the only thing we had a problem with was the parking.After a night out we came back to a packed parking lot.Other than that very nice hotel.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was great and in the vicinity of our concert venue.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the kitchen and bedroom was perfect!
review.negativeRemarks: We got at the hotel to check in by 3:30pm and our room was not ready until after 4pm. This was a pain to have to wait.
review.locationRemarks: We had a concert at Candlestick and it was a short drive.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel, it was quiet, clean and with a small indoor pool and gym.
review.positiveRemarks: the very easy access to and from the hotel; the breakfast and the complimentary dinner.
review.negativeRemarks: Verify the glasses before putting them out to avoid lips injuries.

review.title: took granddaugter to airport
review.reviewText: lots of family came to hotel . we used the pool.ate pizza.kids had lots of fun.

review.title: It was very nice and peaceful. Staff is super!
review.reviewText:
My son's and I had a nice relaxing weekend.
The place is clean and the staff is super nice!
I will definately stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast :)
review.negativeRemarks: The staff seems to know what the guest are doing... and a sale once and a while is great!

review.title: Great Family Spot
review.reviewText:
There was breakfast every day and dinner through the week. The offerings were well prepared and showed variety day to day. Fresh fruit was regularly available. There were warm cookies in the evening and a laundry close to the pool.
It seemed as though every employee assumed responsibility for whatever needed done. The team atmosphere set a great example for our children. We saw Jennifer, Roger and Javier in particular doing everything large and small to make the stay outstanding for everyone.
You can leave your car in the lot and ride the shuttle to the airport, board the BART there, and ride the bus and trolley system to get anywhere you want to go. Jennifer even recommended an APP to help us use the BART. There is a CITY PASS you can purchase that allows you unlimited rides on the bus/trolley system, admission to the Exploratorium (Don't miss!), aquarium, 1 hour ocean cruise, plus more.
The small kitchen, microwave, and small regular fridge were just right for traveling families. And a menu of food offerings for the week was even posted on the fridge.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff created a great atmosphere of cooperation and pride that was just a pleasure to be around.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Ocean, Ghirardelli's Chocolate, Cable Cars, Golden Gate Bridge, Ocean Cruises

review.title: Overall - very nice place to stay.
review.reviewText: We have chosen this hotel because of its convenient location: we wanted to visit the city and the beaches around it. This hotel sits right by the water (there is even a very nice trail for those how like to walk), it easily accessible from the freeway (only 6 miles from San Francisco Downtown). We've chosen room 129 on the 1st floor (right across from the pool, and from the back exit, and the back parking lot). This queen suit with a kitchenette was very clean; there were full-size refrigerator, microwave, dishes, silverware, dishwasher+detergent, paper towels, coffeemaker, individual packs of coffee and condiments, even a free pack of microwavable popcorn; there were a stove top, and a pot and a pan which we didn't get to use). The breakfast buffet offered plenty of food, including hot items, though you should try to go there earlier (after 8 am there was a line both days, and people had to wait for some items to be refilled). Three things to mention about this particular room: since it is so close to the eating area, the room fills with all those breakfast smells in the morning; there is a service laundry room on the left - when we came for a break during the day, we could hear the big washers spinning, but in the evening it was quiet; the 1st night we had to call the front desk because of noises from the room above, but the manager took care of it very quickly, and the next day we even got an apology note and a chocolate bar from him.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room, kitchenette, pool, breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Near airport, 6 mi from downtown, Tanforan mall and restaurants nearby, Pacifica beach

review.title: Good value hotel but service was terrible!
review.reviewText: We arrived at the hotel on July 5 at approximately 9:15 p.m. We had to wait in line for the front desk for about 10 minutes. We obtained the room key and walk in tired (a 3 year old and 8 month old) to find backpacks and a can of beer on the small dining table - not our room!! We were quite surprised and upset at this serious front desk error. Imagine what may have happened (or what could have been happening) if guests were in the room at the time! After trudging down to the front desk, we had to wait in line for 10 minutes again to only receive, "oh, sorry, I'm dyslexic here's the right room key". Service was very much sub-par in that regard. The breakfast itself was great (eggs, sausage, bacon, bagels, juices, etc) but the line went out the dining area into the front desk. There were at least 30 people in line on a Saturday morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Service was poor, staff needs to be educated about what things can be done to mitigate a very poor experience for a customer.
review.locationRemarks: Close to downtown SF, easy access to highway.

review.title: Great staff and big smiles.
review.reviewText: Wonderful place. Great staff and big smiles. Only had the chance to have breakfast and it was delicious. Rooms were super clean, well appointed, and the beds were very compfortable. Highly recommended!

review.title: great for long stays, biz travellers and families
review.reviewText:
convenient location, rooms though a little smaller than most homewoods still comfortable, with recent renovations complete, common areas are cozy.

staff extremely helpful going out of their way to make sure the stay was in fact comfortable and that we were satisfied.
review.negativeRemarks: dining area cramped at peak times
review.locationRemarks: convenient for travel into and out of city. driving to and from moscone center every morning and evening took less than 1/2 an hour in traffic

review.title: This hotel is recommended
review.reviewText:
Last minute reservation. Hotel was clean. Room clean. Only cons were as the 2 cigarette burns in the sink area of the bathroom and the 2 stray hairs left behind in the bathroom. I feel like I'm knit picking at this point. Bottom line--Great hotel. Can't go wrong. Includes daily breakfast and dinner on weeknights.
I recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast included. Free Parking. Free WiFi.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Looks to be a Business area on the waterfront. Seems a little desolate.

review.title: Xmas in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We were staying over Xmas, visiting the San Francisco area.

We had a great stay, the hotel was very well kept and the staff very friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast room was very busy
review.locationRemarks: great location for San Francisco and the California coast

review.title: No again
review.reviewText: small room with reduce space, we got a queen with a sofabed instead of two queens offered. we had to park at radison due lack of parking lots, we were rejected when we ask cancel our last night of four, no helpful staff.
review.positiveRemarks: decent breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: no helpful people at the reception
review.locationRemarks: in the middle of nothing, hard to get san francisco in public transport.

review.title: A hotel feel like home
review.reviewText: The suites are very roomy compared to the other hotels' standard rooms. The hotel is a bit old but the room is clean. Feel like staying home. Good for families.
review.positiveRemarks: The kitchenette, the on-site launderette.
review.negativeRemarks: The swimming pool is always busy.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to drive to downtown San Francisco (15 minutes), airport (5 minutes), Daly city (10 minutes for good Chinese food).

review.title: Great hotel for couple!
review.reviewText: This hotel is very good, the best hotel we have ever stayed. Thanks a lot!

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: This hotel was just perfect! Great price very comfortable and thee hotel staff was very helpful and friendly! I will definetaly stay here again no complains.

review.title: Great hotel for a family
review.reviewText: Great place for a family to stay. Close to downtown San Francisco. My daughter, her husband, my grandson, and I all stayed in a one bedroom suite. It worked out great. The breakfast was good and they provided plenty of food. Great bargain.
review.positiveRemarks: Separate bedroom, hot breakfast
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Great Time
review.reviewText: Great Hotel for everybody! My boyfriend and I had a great time. Breakfast was awesome!

review.title: Napa Weekend
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay. Breakfast was good. Nothing to do in the immediate area you need to drive for fun and eating.

review.title: Cramped at candlestick
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice but suites are very small. Bedroom is not separated from living area and there is only one tv in the bedroom. Conflicts with children on what to watch.And we had to all sit on the bed to watch. Ughhhh! Overall, it was ok. Close to Candlestick which was good for us. Not sure this family of four would do this again.

review.title: Pick this one if you have a family
review.reviewText: I would stay here again, if I visit San Francisco again. Great location from downtown at a great rate. WONDERFUL staff. Great value. Good for families. The kitchenette, drawer and cabinet space, and hide-a-bed are helpful amenities! Overall, good stay for the price.

review.title: Great value with lots of perks
review.reviewText: Convenient and clean hotel, ideal for overnight or short stays for both single travellers and families. Free parking, free hot breakfast, free PCs for printing your bording passes are all nice touches.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room cleanliness and furnishing
review.negativeRemarks: Slow elevators
review.locationRemarks: Nicely located between SFO and San Francisco, very convenient to drive around the Bay area

review.title: The perfect hotel!!!
review.reviewText: If I could rate this hotel higher I would. Very nice rooms. Breakfast was fantastic. (The breakfast staff puts this place over the top). Perfect location for sight seeing or attending a 49ers game. All staff we encountered were very friendly and very helpfull. Not a single negative during our 3 nights stay. I have already recommended this hotel to a friend that will be visiting next month.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was very comfortable, Breakfast and staff way way above average.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing bad to say. Perfection.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Easy access to all major attractions. Very nice area. Nice walking path right next to the water.

review.title: great experience
review.reviewText: Great breakfast each morning! And it's served until 11am. Also the staff let us check in early which really helped to jump start our trip!

review.title: Nice hotel. Great staff. Would use again.
review.reviewText: Great experience. Easy drive to/from San Francisco downtown/piers. It was on the pricey side, but we made good use of the fridge, microwave, and plates. The fold-out bed in the couch was perfect. The swing-out arm for the HDTV was a very nice touch. A lot of outlets throughout made recharging all our devices easy. Housekeeping ran dirty dishes through dishwasher everyday! Awesome! Included breakfast was very nice. Oh, and we received local newspaper every morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Housekeeping, kitchen
review.negativeRemarks: Little to no plane noise, but highway traffic is audible at night.
review.locationRemarks: Not too bad. Highway is close by. Easy commute to SF.

review.title: Excellent room - breakfast needs help
review.reviewText:
The room was excellent. We stayed for 2 nights. Our only problem was the breakfast, both days the line was long and the food was low when you finally got to the table with the hot items. The fresh fruit also was gone both days and had to be requested to be refilled. Just a note it was at least an hour before the close time for breakfast. Seemed not to be enough staff for the kitchen, getting the food changed, and maintaining the cleaning fo the seating area.
One more thing, I booked through Expedia so I am disappointed the nights will not go towards points on my Honor points.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, quiet room, room was large
review.negativeRemarks: Line at breakfast and shortage of staff at kitchen and dining area
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Airport North - Brisbane

review.title: Clean Hotel.
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a business park area. There is not any resturants, stores, gas stations, etc nearby. So either eat before you get there or bring your own food to cook in your room. The hotel was clean. The employees were a little hard to understand. The pool is only 3 feet deep and is really small. We checked in to our hotel and went to find something to eat. When we returned the parking lot was full. We had a room, but no where to park. Very upsetting. The continental breakfast is ok. Nothing spectacular.
review.locationRemarks: Located in a business park. No resturants, stores, or gas stations nearby.

review.title: Great hotel for family
review.reviewText: Great location, Clean, staff very attentive and helpful. Breakfast is great!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
