review.reviewText: excellent, the location is perfect near of union square and the tourist area
review.positiveRemarks: my room , quality of staff, breakfast, all

review.title: I love this hotel!
review.reviewText:
I like the hotel a lot, because I have a small child and it is very comfortable to have a mini apartment when you are travelling. IT is very comfortable to have a kitchen with all kitchen dishes, tools...This hotel is also not far away from SFO downtown. IT takes usually to drive about 15-20 minutes to get to all interesting things to do in SFO. The price is also fine for what you get.
I also like the indoor pool at this hotel. My son loves to swim there!
review.positiveRemarks: Room itself, kitchen, TV programs for kids
review.negativeRemarks: I didn't like so much our last stay. The heater was very loud and annoying, the cold air was blowing instead of warm.
review.locationRemarks: The location is fine, quiet, comfortable . I choose this hotel every time I can.This hotel is great for families who has kids!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to San Fran. and airport. Great breakfast and good evening meal w/drinks. The staff was very friendly and for the most part helpful. On the downside we were put in a smoking room even tho we requested non-smoking and could not move because hotel was booked up. So much for booking our room 3 months in advance.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff, especially the gentleman who oversees the breakfast buffet. Very friendly and helpful man.
review.positiveRemarks: Great hotel for business traveler's since they include dinner Mondays through Thursdays.
review.negativeRemarks: The king bedded rooms are a little far from the dining room...but they are very nice rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Good location with enough parking even with a full hotel.

review.title: We will be back.
review.reviewText:
I was pleasantly surprised by the care that the property was given and the friendly staff.
We enjoyed the breakfast and could not believe how fast and how hard the crew worked to keep everything fresh and stocked.
I will definitely return.
review.positiveRemarks: plenty of room
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel. For the price, it was amazing. Great room, great breakfasts, decent location, great staff, all good things.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.

review.title: Not much of a suite
review.reviewText:
These rooms shouldn't really be called suites. It is a single L-shaped room, with no separation between the living and sleeping areas, or even between the sleeping area and bathroom vanity. It would work find for a single person or a couple, but travelling with my wife and teenage daughter, I could have used a little more privacy.

The worst thing was that in a non-smoking room, the sofa bed, and especially the pillows, reeked of cigarettes. Again, if we hadn't had 3 people, we would never have noticed the problem. But it is a simple housekeeping matter to see that clean pillows are in the room. A minor issue is that the shower drain was clogged.

Overall, this is a nice hotel. The complimentary breakfast was good and the free internet worked well. We were able to take advantage of the swimming pool and exercise room. However, if you can't sleep because of the smell of the room, it trumps the other amenities. There are plenty of other places I would try before I stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Good amenities, nice room for 1 or 2.
review.negativeRemarks: More like a single room than a suite. Non-smoking was not.
review.locationRemarks: Attractive setting and good location near the airport and freeways.

review.title: clean, comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: This is a very great hotel and I love it so much, it's close to the airport and very easy to take the hotel shuttle. If you don't have a car, you can take the hotel shuttle to the international terminal and take the BART to downtown, it's very convenient and not far away.It's a nice journey to stay here!
review.positiveRemarks: bed and bathroom
review.locationRemarks: convenient

review.title: Good Place for a Family.
review.reviewText: I LOVE Homewood Suites! We stayed in 1 bedroom King Suite with kitchen. The pull out bed was okay for our kids but not so great for adults. Great breakfast and great staff. Sausages, eggs, hash browns, waffles, fresh fruit, and more. My only complaints were the pillows, no fan in bathroom, and the pool was more like a cold hot tub without bubbles. However, I would stay there again and the breakfast made it well worth it! This is our second stay at a Homewood Suites.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: We had a great stay. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was great. We will stay again if we get the chance.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I really liked this Hotel because the rooms were very clean and when a room is non-smoking it's really non-smoking because I didnt smell any kind of cigarette smoke at all in which I liked a lot. They have a very friendly staff and the buffet breakfast was pretty decent as well. I would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: It's a great location because it's not very far from Downtown SF.

review.title: Great Accommodation! Highly Recommend.
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel! Excellent service by friendly staff. Very comfortable and clean accommodation. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Also--great breakfast for a nice start to a busy day. :-)
review.positiveRemarks: breakfast in nice dining area, kitchenette in suite, cleanliness and comfort
review.negativeRemarks: None.
review.locationRemarks: Nice view of bay. Felt safe at this location.

review.title: really nice
review.reviewText: a real surprise.. everything was great... close to airport & close & easy to drive to all san fransico ... would do it again...

review.title: service friendlier than other homewood suites
review.reviewText:
This Homewood Suites room was slightly smaller than I am used to staying in when I travel for work. Only feature of the Queen Studio I was in that I felt to be inconvenient was the placement of the television in such a way that it was only visible from the bed or desk but not from the couch.

The rest of the hotel is as comfortable, convenient and friendly as any Homewood Suites or Hilton hotel.

Most outstanding was their service during breakfast and dinners where the hosts were friendly and helpful making the stay far more comfortable than other Homewood and especially more so than other competing hotels providing similar services.

Location is close enough to the city without actually being in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: service by front desk and hosts
review.negativeRemarks: size of the room and layout. had to be on the bed in order to watch television
review.locationRemarks: ideal for travel into the city. less than 10 minute drive to moscone.

review.title: Better than expected.
review.reviewText:
Friendly and efficient front desk staff. Surprisingly good free buffet breakfast with an energetic host who was very engaged and concerned for the quality of the food and environment.

Beautiful environs with a wonder bayside walking trail.

Well priced--a great value.

review.title: This was our second time staying at this hotel and we plan to stay again.
review.reviewText: All the staff members were friendly and efficient. We enjoyed our stay and plan to return in the spring. Very good location.

review.title: Anniversary Trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We had a rented car and easily drove into San Francisco to see the sights. We went out to Sonoma one day and Muirwoods/Saulsalito area another day. It was so nice to have this very comfortable oasis to return to, we could recharge in a clean, quiet, hotel before returning to seeing the sights the next day. We loved being able to cook our own eggs in the morning. They have a full hot buffet breakfast in the lobby area, we used this to supplement our home cooked breakfast in the room. The staff was very helpful and friendly, everyone who worked there seemed to be giving an extra effort to make the hotel the best it can be. We found the hotel to be very convenient to getting anywhere. I will look for a Homewood Suites the next time we travel.
review.locationRemarks: We loved our visit to Muirwoods, you need to visit very early, or walk a ways to get away from the crowd. Very peaceful. Take a picnic lunch and travel down to Muir Beach on Pacific ocean. Really enjoyed our visit to Sonoma, Sebastaini Wine Cellars, we took a wine blending class with them. In Sonoma, have lunch at Sunflower Cafe in square, they have wonderful garden patio in back. Our favorite dinner out in San Francisco was Ana Mandara in Ghiradellii square. Drive Great Hwy thru Persidio park - awesome views of Golden Gate and Pacific ocean near Cliff House. We found buying a tour on the hop on/hop off buses to be very helpful and efficient way to see the city, however, even tho they look the same at first glance there are several different tour operators, look closely and compare before you buy. Do the cable car on a week day, nearly impossible on a weekend. Most economical parking garage we found at 350 Beach street.

review.title: San Francisco Gem
review.reviewText: If you have a car, this is a great place to stay. Very nice and cheaper than staying in the city or by the warf.

review.title: Great but not exceptional
review.reviewText: I have stayed at other Homewoods and this hotel was great but not exceptional. It was average for a Homewood property. Breakfast was great, but again not as nice as some others I have stayed at. I may be measuring it with too high a stick, but other Homewoods I have stayed at were amazing--this was a little short of amazing. The rooms are small suites and met our needs. They were clean and modern with comfortable beds and pillows. Not enough room for a bigger family, but great for several people. The area is a business park and there is really nothing around other than commercial buildings (that makes the area secure and quiet). You may want to eat or shop before getting to the hotel.

review.title: Good Location, Good Price
review.reviewText: Good location , close to the airport and to the city with shuttle bus service

review.title: Great Breakfast and Dinner
review.reviewText:
Hotel was very close to airport in small, secure office building area, very nice room with kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and room with sofa, easy chair and tv. TV was NOT a 32" flatscreen which is what I am used to seeing in rooms now.
Complimentary breakfast and dinner were good with good staff help. Room service was very good and frondest staff were very helpful as was the small snack shop with some cold items such as ice cream and others. Daily USA Today was nice as was the lobby area with easy chairs and a working fireplace and free computer and printer use. Would stay there again!

review.title: Wonderful and enjoyable stay
review.reviewText:
It has been a really good and wonderful stay - there was everything you can actually want. Decent, clean, friendly, responsive staff, fully equipped rooms, convenient location etc.
And the breakfast and free (I) dinner was really good! They even had the power adapter for European style cameras etc. (that actually saved my life:)
I really suggest you staying at this hotel!

review.title: Wonderful hotel; commercial neighborhood
review.reviewText: The only thing that isn't so great about this Homewood Suites location is the commercial neighborhood and maybe the tricky way you must get get off the freeway to access it if you are south bound on Highway 101. Doing a Map Quest or Google Map search is highly recommended if you are driving there. Access to computer is provided in the lobby for finding your way around once you are there. There are no eateries close by (within walking distance) so a car is a must! Otherwise, it provides easy access to SF and surrounding areas.

review.title: very satisfied
review.reviewText: very satisfied with hotel..comfortable,clean and friendly, accomodating staff

review.title: We will probably stay ay Homewood during our next visit.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. Staff was helpful. Good location for long walks. Easy drive to city.

review.title: My base in Silicon Valley / SF.
review.reviewText:
Nice location in middle of Silicon Valley and San Francisco Downtown. Close from SFO airport but not such noisy.
No luxury but a kind of home feeling. Good for mid/long term stay with fridge and microwave and semi-separated dining and bedroom. Wi-fi strength was not fully satisfaction but OK level.

No store in walk distance. You see Walmart Com on Google map but it's their office. Mall and place to eat in South San Fransico (10-15min drive).
Another on Google map, it is shown that you can access from Oyster Point Blvd, but you can't (it's a walk path). You should take Sierra Point Parkway exit.

review.title: Awesome hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful. It was spotless and comfortable. The bed was heavenly (and the mattress was clean). The room was a nice size with a cute little kitchen. The sink area was seperate from the shower/toilet, which is great for busy mornings. It was very quiet and relaxing. The breakfast was great, with a nice variety of food. Each morning there were two egg dishes, a meat, potatoes, cereal, milk, fruit, yogurt, juices, coffee, everything you could desire. The employees were friendly, cheerful and helpful, especially the breakfast dude, who always made sure everyone had everything they needed. The location was so convenient--close to the airport, easy to find, very short drive to the wharf and downtown. We loved this hotel! It was a great price, convenient, clean, quiet, nicely furnished. I wouldn't change a thing. Highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Superb airport hotel!
review.reviewText: Super convenient airport hotel. Freeway access very easy. Rooms are very comfortable with a sitting area and full kitchen. Great for extended stay or just one night. Super breakfast in the morning consisting of eggs, potatoes, meat, breads, cereals, juice, coffee, etc. Great way to start your day! Helpful staff, clean facilities, quiet location. Just 15 minutes to downtown San Francisco. We will definitely stay again!

review.title: Homewood-SanFran
review.reviewText: It was a great experience. The hotel stay was very satisfied.

review.title: Great stay at a great price
review.reviewText:
The hotel reception was great, better than i expected for the price. The room was clean and comfortable, hotel amenities was great,
Staff was friendly and accomodating, of particular mention was the breakfast service manager who made sure that everyone was comfortable and welcome at breakfast time. His mood was one that was infectious and I thought that was a great way to start the day. There is also a welcome home dinner as well which i found was a nice touch. I would say again and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good budget hotel.

review.title: friendliest staff I have ever encountered!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were wonderful, our room was comfortable and they went above and beyond.

review.title: Good value for the money
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because the rates were competitive, it was not too far from San Francisco, and it had a complimentary breakfast buffet. We were pleasantly surprised to find there was also a complimentary dinner buffet most evenings! The bathroom had a large shower stall but I would have preferred a bathtub (not sure if other rooms have tubs).

review.title: A good place to stay.
review.reviewText:
Great hotel if you want to be able to cook your own meals while on vacation, unfortunately there aren't any stores nearby the hotel to purchase basic groceries like bread, milk, eggs etc.

You will need a car if you plan to visit San Francisco and the surrounding areas, but you can always catch the hotel shuttle to the airport which is very close and ride on the Bart, although we found the Bart to be very expensive so we opted to hire a car instead.

The hotel and room was clean, and the kids loved the pool. I wish there was a Spa Bath and I also would have liked the pool to stay open a little later.

Breakfast was good with a nice variety at breakfast, only problem was there was very limited seating so you had to wait for a table to eat, in fact the hotel room itself only had a table for two, so we let the kids eat first and then we would eat. Maybe this needs to be looked at by the management.

review.title: Great hotel for the prce!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! The room was ready when we got in at 12pm. The breakfast was great. The ran out of waffle mix but everything else was great. Top quality for a 3 star hotel. I will be back!!

review.title: Great, buy lots
review.reviewText: The biggest asset this hotel has are it's people. The front desk people, housekeeping manager and breakfast host were especially helpful. Could use a couple more computers for public use and printing.

review.title: Homewood Suites SF
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff is great. Management is very accommodating. We had stayed for an entire week and halfway through our stay we had experienced "smoke" in the bathroom. The management had recommended to move us toe a different room which is better for the inconvenience. Our initial room was great, clean and comfortable. The second room provided was even better even though we were satisfied with this hotel initially. With exception to cigarette smoke from the restroom, this is a great hotel, beats many hotels is the area when it compares to quality, price and comfort.

review.title: Quiet place to stay at San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Homewood suites was one of the best hotels in its class I ever stayed in US. Its breakfast was rich and delicious. Serving self service waffle in breakfast is ingenious. Rooms are comfortable and useful. Whereas my bed needed some repair since it produces strange sounds. There are a lot of pillow choices which is very good for people like me. It is very difficult for me to sleep peacefully if the pillow is too thick or too thin.
It is located in a quite beautiful place with bay view. It is easy to reach and most of the times there is no traffic jam on main access road 101. I'm very satisfied with my stay in Homewood suites and I highly recommend it to anybody whether travel alone or with family.

review.title: Good Hotel, Not so good location
review.reviewText: The hotel room, services, and the ambience was good. The biggest problem we faced was with the location of the hotel as there were no convenient stores/gas station available nearby.

review.title: Great Stay outside of San Francisco
review.reviewText: The overall experience was better than we expected, the quality of the breakfast was great, the location was perfect for us, room was clean, roomy, and quiet. We appreciated the kitchenette, microwave, stove, and refrigerator. Staff was helpful, shuttle was convenient and on-time, services suited our every need, ie. laundry, snack shop, internet in the lobby, the whole experience was very pleasant.

review.title: Over and above expectations
review.reviewText: Had no issues. Smelled smoke in room and was immediately transferred to another room and received complimentary bottled water and chocolate bars the next morning.

review.title: Nice, clean, quiet
review.reviewText:
This was one of the better hotel stays we experienced during the 2009-10 Holiday season. The suite it well sized with a little kitchenette, TV in the living room, and TV in the bedroom Comfortable bed, spacious bathroom, iron, hair-dryer, and all the amenities you'd expect from a high-end hotel. Our 3-year old slept on the sofa-bed. The building itself looks like it must be rather new, if not recently renovated. Location is a bit quirky...pushed to the edge of the bay by the San Bruno State Park, it's on a narrow strip of land that accommodates US-101, a marina and other hotels, so that doesn't leave much room for anything else. If you want to go out for dinner you'll need to drive to Brisbane (or somewhere further if you want). Bring your GPS or a good map to get you there, especially for night-time driving since there is no lighting to speak of along Sierra Point Parkway and its a bit disorienting to find yourself surrounded by water without many visual reference points in the dark.

Breakfast would have probably been better if it hadn't been so mobbed. The dining area is clearly not designed to handle much of the hotel population and we had to take our food to our room.

review.title: great customer service
review.reviewText: the staff was very friendly, they even printed me a map of a nearby bait shop (fishing acess across the street). The break fast and room was very nice. I look foward to my next stay.

review.title: i,ll return
review.reviewText: they ran out of coffee and did not refill the pot at breakfast. the hotel manger was not very helpful

review.title: On our permanent list
review.reviewText: We travel through SFO frequently and occasionally arrive late enough so that an airporter hotel is just easier. Booked this place sight unseen on an Expedia special rate, and were delighted with our stay. Comfortable and well-appointed small suite, delightful desk staff and we were amazed at the quality and variety of the buffet full breakfast included in the reasonable room rate (no tired pre-packaged muffins or weak coffee being called a "continental breakfast"). Close to the airport and easy to find right off an exit if you're driving; complimentary airport shuttle if not. We'll definitely stay here again (and again)!

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at Homewood Suites. The only disappointment was that we thought we had reserved a smoking room but when we checked in we were informed that the hotel wouldn't not guarantee that request through Expedia. It really wasn't a big deal, just a minor inconvenience. We did wish they had a restaurant (only a breakfast buffet) but we were able to go next door to the Radisson for an evening meal. Shuttle service to and from the airport was a plus. We would stay there again.

review.title: Don't stay anywhere else near San Francisco
review.reviewText: If you don't need to stay in the city itself, Homewood Suites offers an amazing value for the accommodations it provides. Large, clean rooms and extremely comfortable beds make every stay (I've stayed at least half a dozen times) enjoyable. The kitchen is great for making small meals, and the food offered during the week is a nice touch. Breakfast is good, but the food runs out quick if the hotel is busy. The only thing I would like is a newer television (LCD would be great) and maybe a dvd player. Other than that, top marks.

review.title: Very nice stay
review.reviewText: The only thing that spoiled the stay at all was noisy neighbors the first night. They moved us immediately when I made a complaint and the rest of the stay was great. The whole hotel was much nicer than expected and the kitchenette was appreciated as was the breakfast provided. Hotel service did not clean the room the first day which is not unusual for a suite, but after that everything was superb. I would certainly recomend this place for anyone, especially a family, as the rooms are large, the couch converted to a bed, the kitchen, and the service. I plan on returning next year.

review.title: Thanks to very good receptions and transportation and clean staff
review.reviewText: It was totally very nice

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly, the airport shuttle was convenient and the suite was clean and comfortable. The manager's dinner was an added bonus.

review.title: Great Jumping off point
review.reviewText: We recently spend four nights at this hotel and found that the staff provided excellent service, the food served at breakfast was more then expected. Our room was clean and comfortable, could not ask for a better places to stay while touring the bay area.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We were extremely impressed with this hotel and would highly recommend it. Shuttle service was excellent to airport for flights or for BART transit terminal at airport to go downtown. Room was well equipped for self-catering and comfort. Hot and continental breakfast served in spacious dining room. Reception staff were courteous and helpful and free internet in lobby area was very useful.

review.title: Wonderful location
review.reviewText: If you want a hotel near the water fairly close to the city, but with a small-town feel, this is it. The only problem was a discovering a dishwasher broken at night, but the hotel fixed it promptly the next morning. Everything was clean and neat, and the bed was very comfortable. I would recommend it and would love to stay there again.

review.title: Wish we could have stayed longer!
review.reviewText: The hotel was better than what we had invisioned. We had an exceptional rate with Expedia and never could have enjoyed a room like that. It was spacious, beautifully decorated, free breakfast in the morning and an inside pool which allowed our girls to have some play time. I would definately go back. With having a small kitchen, I would consider my next stay to be longer. Our stay was just a brief weekend. All the other mom's and girls that traveled with us were just as surprised when they opened their doors. Thank you Expedia for offering such an awesome rate.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: It was nice and big and quiet. Our suite had plenty of room, a full refrigerator, microwave, 2 burner stove and dishwasher! Daily breakfasts were good and the weeknight dinners were okay; the cocktails were limited but the beer was good. The freezer wAs great! The pool was good sized but only 3 feet but that was great for a quick dip, if a little cold. We have a 4 year old so it was perfect. Needs a hot tub though! Nightly warm cookies were good and daily fruit and paper were good, wE'LL STAY THERE EVERY TIME WE HAVE TO GO TO sAN fRANCISCO AT THESE RATES!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Good price, good location, good breakfast provided.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: It's comfortable, excellent service.

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: Very friendly and professional staff.

review.title: plain jane
review.reviewText: Simplicity to the max, no frills at all. A three foot pool - why bother. The rooms are small and somewhat bare. Would I stay there again - yes, would it be my first preference - no. It reminded me more of a Motel6 property than a Hilton property. Very generic! Very thin walls, I mean really paper thin walls.

review.title: Surprisingly nice
review.reviewText: I was expecting a low rate hotel and was surprised with a moderately nice hotel. Definitely on the high end of 3 star hotels. The suite was nice for the space. We traveled with our dog and the staff was willing to accomodate (for a $75 cleaning charge). The room was a little dirty but I figured it was because it was a designated pet room. The free parking was also a big incentive. The hotel is only about 10 miles from the San Francisco and is an easy drive.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The room was nice, comfortable, and clean. I enjoyed the continental breakfast each morning because it was complete with both hot and cold food choices. Additionally, they also offered a complimentary dinner Monday through Thursday which helped with our food cost. They had free internet access available in the hotel lobby. However, the internet connection was extremely slow.

review.title: Would definately return
review.reviewText: Great hotel, clean sheets, very comfortable room and the hotel is situated in a very convenient location

review.title: Nice Place to stay
review.reviewText: Everything was nice except the carpets needed to be shampooed. Otherwise, great place to stay.

review.title: Very Surprised!
review.reviewText: I was a little hesitant because the price was very cheap and located away from the city but surprisingly the hotel room was very cozy with amazing pillows and blankets. The bathroom was clean and it looked like the hotel has some renovations done to it. I even liked the hotel soup and shampoo, which is rare because hotel products are horrible. But kudos to you Hilton Corp for fixing it up.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: More motel than we were expecting.Room was nice,bed was very comfortable,professional service, wish we could have stayed longer!

review.title: GREAT PLACE!
review.reviewText: This hotel was the best I have ever stayed in. The location was great & so was the view! The room was decorated beautifully and was very clean. The staff were nice, and the free breakfast was great. It was also great to have free parking, a full kitchen, workout room, and pool.

review.title: Homewood Suites Hilton in Brisbane
review.reviewText: I really appreciated how friendly and helpful the staff were at the hotel, where it was to arrange for transportation (as the hotel is midway between the airport and downtown) or for directions to the local gas station, accessing the business center... I have found that place in San Fran where I would prefer for my future stays.

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: Our trip was planned around a food festival in Golden Gate Park so we had to be close by and we had to have a kitchenette. We chose this hotel because of a weekend special rate and honestly expected a mini fridge and microwave along with a lot of noise because of its close proximity to SFO Airport. We were pleasantly surprised when we walked into a 2-room suite with vaulted ceilings and a kitchen that included a full size refrigerator, microwave, 2-burner stove, dishwasher and cutlery. As for the noise level there were no issues although there was a train track behind us and even though we were on the first floor it was barely noticeable. The only thing this hotel was missing was a Jacuzzi which could have come in very handy to relax in on the days we were walking all over beautiful Golden Gate Park.

review.title: Very comfortable
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay. Friendly staff. Quiet and away from the city. Convenient to the Airport. Great view of the bay.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: 1. Ensure you are not on the highway or train side, excessively noisy, no sleep. 2. Desk staff go overboard to help and are supre polite, got us a room away from train and highway at our request. 3. Get good directions and a strip map to hotel if driving. It is difficult to find without help. Some what removed from anything in any direction, but transportation workable with patience or a car. Parking down town S.F a real challenge. 4. Bottem line, we'd go back to this hotel, but we'd put in a request to have a room away from the highway/railroad up front.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient to the airport
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the location and the condition of this hotel. Homewood Suites are typically one of our favorite hotels and we were not disappointed during our stay here.

review.title: nice place
review.reviewText: The fitness center was a little sparse. Treadmills and dumbbells

review.title: quite comfortable, close to SF without the hassle
review.reviewText: nice hotel, very pleasant staff, extremely helpful. Rooms are nice, easily sleep 4, pleasant kitchenette. Complimentary breakfast is good. Not the greatest variety but quite well done and will satify any big breakfast eater. Will definitely go there again next time I have kids with me...

review.title: Will stay with them again
review.reviewText: Was very happy with all parts of the hotel

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: We really liked this hotel. We only wished we had spent more time there. We were only there overnight. We were impressed with the nice kitchen but never had a chance to use it. We will next time!

review.title: Will stay again.........
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, very clean, great rooms!!! Excellent location except for finding dining options - have to go into downtown SF to get decent food - but that's wht you get if you stay away from the hussle and bussle!!! All in all a great Hotel in a Nice location, kinda off the beat and path - exactly what we were lookin for.

review.title: Vacation starting point
review.reviewText: It was a nice place. You will need a car if you intend on doing anything other than staying in the hotel. Short drive to downtown and the airport. Great Breakfast.

review.title: loved the kitchenette
review.reviewText: great room for the price friendly service,quiet and peaceful location all the amenities i needed, would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We are so happy to have found this hotel. We were impressed with the service provided by the hotel staff. They were extremely friendly and helpful. Our room had everything that we could have wanted and then some. We will definitely look for this hotel chain whereever we travel.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: very clean, staff very helpful.i can recommend it anybody.

review.title: Great! Comfort & Value
review.reviewText: Homestead Suites in Brisbane is a lovely efficiency type one bedroom apartment equipped with either two doubles or a king sized bed(with a sofa bed in the living area - my grandaughter slept on it and she had no complaints). For short stays or if you like to eat out, the two burner stove and microwave are sufficient. The refrig is full sized and so is the dishwasher! Two TV's were nice as was the small, but adequate, indoor swimming pool and fitness center. A full breakfast is provided everyday, (tho' the dining area is small)- eggs, bacon, corned beef hash one day and sausage the other, fried potatoes, fresh fruit, dry cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, make-your-own waffle, bread and bagels for toast w/cream cheese or real butter. If you happen to be there Mon - Thurs, a dinner is served (don't know if there is a charge and the menu is fixed - but in your room so you know in advance what will be served). Very clean and microwave popcorn, coffe & tea were in the room when we arrived. Enough dishes, etc. for four. I would go back if I need to be in the S.F. area again. Note: It is very difficult to figure out how to get to the facility from the freeway. Call and get directions before you go or download a map/driving directions. It is not in the city of Brisbane and the closest area for real choice in places to eat is San Bruno - south of the facility, but an easy drive down the freeway.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Free parking, friendly staff, free breakfast.
